sentence1: Dschang Liang was a native of one of those states which had been destroyed by the Emperor Tsin Schi Huang.
sentence2: And Dschang Liang determined to do a deed for his dead king's sake, and to that end gathered followers with whom to slay Tsin Schi Huang.

sentence1: And Dschang Liang determined to do a deed for his dead king's sake, and to that end gathered followers with whom to slay Tsin Schi Huang.
sentence2: Once Tsin Schi Huang was making a progress through the country.

sentence1: Once Tsin Schi Huang was making a progress through the country.
sentence2: When he came to the plain of Bo Lang, Dschang Liang armed his people with iron maces in order to kill him.

sentence1: When he came to the plain of Bo Lang, Dschang Liang armed his people with iron maces in order to kill him.
sentence2: But Tsin Schi Huang always had two traveling coaches which were exactly alike in appearance.

sentence1: But Tsin Schi Huang always had two traveling coaches which were exactly alike in appearance.
sentence2: In one of them he sat himself, while in the other was seated another person.

sentence1: In one of them he sat himself, while in the other was seated another person.
sentence2: Dschang Liang and his followers met the decoy wagon, and Dschang Liang was forced to flee from the Emperor's rage.

sentence1: Dschang Liang and his followers met the decoy wagon, and Dschang Liang was forced to flee from the Emperor's rage.
sentence2: He came to a ruined bridge.

sentence1: He came to a ruined bridge.
sentence2: There he met an old, old man wearing a black turban and a yellow gown.

sentence1: There he met an old, old man wearing a black turban and a yellow gown.
sentence2: The old man let one of his shoes fall into the water, looked at Dschang Liang and said: "Fetch it out, little one!"

sentence1: The old man let one of his shoes fall into the water, looked at Dschang Liang and said: "Fetch it out, little one!"
sentence2: Dschang Liang controlled himself, fetched out the shoe and brought it to the old man.

sentence1: Dschang Liang controlled himself, fetched out the shoe and brought it to the old man.
sentence2: The latter stretched out his foot to allow Dschang Liang to put it on, which he did in a respectful manner.

sentence1: The latter stretched out his foot to allow Dschang Liang to put it on, which he did in a respectful manner.
sentence2: This pleased the old man and he said: "Little one, something may be made of you!

sentence1: This pleased the old man and he said: "Little one, something may be made of you!
sentence2: Come here to-morrow morning early, and I will have something for you."

sentence1: Come here to-morrow morning early, and I will have something for you."
sentence2: The following morning at break of dawn, Dschang Liang appeared.

sentence1: The following morning at break of dawn, Dschang Liang appeared.
sentence2: But the old man was already there and reproached him: "You are too late.

sentence1: But the old man was already there and reproached him: "You are too late.
sentence2: To-day I will tell you nothing.

sentence1: To-day I will tell you nothing.
sentence2: To-morrow you must come earlier."

sentence1: To-morrow you must come earlier."
sentence2: So it went on for three days, and Dschang Liang's patience was not exhausted.

sentence1: So it went on for three days, and Dschang Liang's patience was not exhausted.
sentence2: Then the old man was satisfied, brought forth the Book of Hidden Complements, and gave it to him.

sentence1: Then the old man was satisfied, brought forth the Book of Hidden Complements, and gave it to him.
sentence2: "You must read it," said he, "and then you will be able to rule a great emperor.

sentence1: "You must read it," said he, "and then you will be able to rule a great emperor.
sentence2: When your task is completed, seek me at the foot of the Gu Tschong Mountain.

sentence1: When your task is completed, seek me at the foot of the Gu Tschong Mountain.
sentence2: There you will find a yellow stone, and I will be by that yellow stone."

sentence1: There you will find a yellow stone, and I will be by that yellow stone."
sentence2: Dschang Liang took the book and aided the ancestor of the Han dynasty to conquer the empire.

sentence1: Dschang Liang took the book and aided the ancestor of the Han dynasty to conquer the empire.
sentence2: The emperor made him a count.

sentence1: The emperor made him a count.
sentence2: From that time forward Dschang Liang ate no human food and concentrated in spirit.

sentence1: From that time forward Dschang Liang ate no human food and concentrated in spirit.
sentence2: Once he met two boys who were singing and dancing: "Green the garments you should wear, If to heaven's gate you'd fare;

sentence1: Once he met two boys who were singing and dancing: "Green the garments you should wear, If to heaven's gate you'd fare;
sentence2: When Dschang Liang heard this, he bowed before the youths, and said to his friends: "Those are angel children of the King Father of the East.

sentence1: When Dschang Liang heard this, he bowed before the youths, and said to his friends: "Those are angel children of the King Father of the East.
sentence2: Whoever would gain immortality, must first greet the Golden Mother and then bow before the King Father.

sentence1: Whoever would gain immortality, must first greet the Golden Mother and then bow before the King Father.
sentence2: The song of the angel children shows the manner in which the hidden knowledge may be acquired."

sentence1: The song of the angel children shows the manner in which the hidden knowledge may be acquired."
sentence2: At about that time the emperor was induced to have some of his faithful servants slain.

sentence1: At about that time the emperor was induced to have some of his faithful servants slain.
sentence2: Then Dschang Liang left his service and went to the Gu Tschong Mountain.

sentence1: Then Dschang Liang left his service and went to the Gu Tschong Mountain.
sentence2: There he found the old man by the yellow stone, gained the hidden knowledge, returned home, and feigning illness loosed his soul from his body and disappeared.

sentence1: There he found the old man by the yellow stone, gained the hidden knowledge, returned home, and feigning illness loosed his soul from his body and disappeared.
sentence2: Later, when the rebellion of the "Red Eyebrows" broke out, his tomb was opened.

sentence1: Later, when the rebellion of the "Red Eyebrows" broke out, his tomb was opened.
sentence2: Dschang Liang was wandering with Laotsze in the invisible world.

sentence1: Dschang Liang was wandering with Laotsze in the invisible world.
sentence2: Once his grandson Dschang Dau Ling went to Kunlun Mountain, in order to visit the Queen Mother of the West.

sentence1: Once his grandson Dschang Dau Ling went to Kunlun Mountain, in order to visit the Queen Mother of the West.
sentence2: There he met Dschang Liang.

sentence1: There he met Dschang Liang.
sentence2: Dschang Dau Ling gained power over demons and spirits, and became the first Taoist pope.
